sen.j: 最中（もなか）とは、餅から作った皮で餡を包んだ和菓子の一種である。
sen.e: Monaka is a kind of Japanese sweets of bean jam wrapped with thin wafers made from rice cake.
Monaka is a kind of Japanese sweets of bean jam wrapped with thin wafers made from rice cake.
Monaka is a kind of Japanese sweets of bean jam wrapped with thin wafers made from rice cake.

sen.j: 餡にクリ、求肥や餅などを入れた変わり最中もある。
sen.e: There are also fancy monakas containing chestnuts, gyuhi (a kind of rice cake made from glutinous rice or glutinous rice flour), or mochi in the bean jam.
There are also fancy monakas containing chestnuts, gyuhi (a kind of rice cake made from glutinous rice or glutinous rice flour), or mochi in the bean jam.
There are also fancy monakas containing chestnuts, gyuhi (a kind of rice cake made from glutinous rice or glutinous rice flour), or mochi in the bean jam.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 最中の原型は、もち米の粉に水を入れてこねたものを蒸し、薄く延ばして円形に切りそろえたものを焼き、仕上げに砂糖をかけた、干菓子であるといわれている。
sen.e: A prototype of monaka is believed to have been dry sweets made by steaming a kneaded mixture of rice powder and water, spreading it into a round thin layer, bake it, and pouring sugar on it.
A prototype of monaka is believed to have been dry sweets made by steaming a kneaded mixture of rice powder and water, spreading it into a round thin layer, baking it, and pouring sugar on it.
A prototype of monaka is believed to have been dry sweets made by steaming a kneaded mixture of rice powder and water, spreading it into a round thin layer, baking it, and pouring sugar on it.

sen.j: これを使って餡を挟んだ菓子が江戸時代に考案された。
sen.e: A sweet of bean jam sandwiched by the dry sweets were invented in Edo period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: A sweet of bean jam sandwiched by the dry sweets was invented in Edo period.
A sweet of bean jam sandwiched by the dry sweets was invented in Edo period.

sen.j: その後も餡を挟む方法に改良が加えられ、明治以降に現在の形の皮が完成した。
sen.e: The way of filling the bean jam were improved since then, and the form of the present thin crisp wafers was completed in Meiji period or later.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The way of filling the bean jam was improved since then, and the form of the present thin crisp wafers was completed in the Meiji period or later.
The way of filling the bean jam was improved since then, and the form of the present thin crisp wafers was completed in the Meiji period or later.

sen.j: 皮の部分は、元が菓子だったことから特別に「皮種」と称されている。
sen.e: The wafer parts are specifically called "tane" because they were originally sweets.
sen.cmt: 「皮種」と一まとめになった熟語（業界用語）はなく、「種」と呼ぶそうなので、それに合わせてtaneと訳しました。
sen.e: The wafer parts are specifically called 'tane' because they were originally sweets.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更
sen.e: The wafer parts are specifically called 'tane' because they were originally sweets.

sen.j: この皮種で餡を挟んだ最中が、やがて全国的に広められていき、現在では各地で色々な種類の最中が銘菓として売り出されている。
sen.e: Monaka made of bean jam sandwiched by the thin crisp wafers became popular over the country, and now various types of monaka are sold in various places as famous confections.
Monaka made of bean jam sandwiched by the thin crisp wafers became popular over the country, and now various types of monaka are sold in various places as famous confections.
Monaka made of bean jam sandwiched by the thin crisp wafers became popular over the country, and now various types of monaka are sold in various places as famous confections.

sen.j: 現在の製法
sen.e: Production method in present days
Production method in present days
Production method in present days

sen.j: 皮種については生地を薄く延ばすところまでは原型と同じであるが、現在は生地をローラーにかけて薄さ数ミリまでに延ばす。
sen.e: While the tane is made in the same way as the prototype until the dough is spread into a thin layer, it is rolled by a roller machine as thin as a few millimeters of thickness.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: While the tane is made in the same way as the prototype until the dough is spread into a thin layer, it is rolled by a roller machine as thin as a few millimeters of thickness.
While the tane is made in the same way as the prototype until the dough is spread into a thin layer, it is rolled by a roller machine as thin as a few millimeters of thickness.

sen.j: これを一定の形に切りそろえた後、皮種専用の焼き型で両面同時に焼いていく。
sen.e: The thin layer is cut into a certain form, and baked on both sides using a baking pan dedicated to the tane.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The thin layer is cut into a certain form, and baked on both sides using a baking pan dedicated to the tane.
The thin layer is cut into a certain form, and baked on both sides using a baking pan dedicated to the tane.

sen.j: すると、餅の澱粉が膨らんで焼き型からはみ出る程まで広がり、軽くて歯触りの良い皮種ができあがる。
sen.e: The rice starch then swells out of the baking pan, and light crisp tane is now completed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The rice starch then swells out of the baking pan, and light crisp tane is now completed.
The rice starch then swells out of the baking pan, and light crisp tane is now completed.

sen.j: また、もち米の粉に水を入れて熱し、それを練ったものを管に通して焼き型にそそぎ込み、直接加熱プレスして皮種を作っていく製法もあり、これにより多彩な形の皮種を作ることも可能になった。
sen.e: It is also possible to make various forms of tane by another production method of heating the mixture of the rice powder and water, kneading it, pouring it into the baking pan through a tube, and directly hot pressing it.

It is also possible to make various forms of tane by another production method of heating the mixture of the rice powder and water, kneading it, pouring it into the baking pan through a tube, and directly hot-pressing it.

It is also possible to make various forms of tane by another production method of heating the mixture of the rice powder and water, kneading it, pouring it into the baking pan through a tube, and directly hot-pressing it.

sen.j: 皮種は一般的に種屋と呼ばれる和菓子材料の専門業者が製造しており、和菓子店へ提供している。
sen.e: The tane is generally produced by professional manufacturers of Japanese sweets materials called "taneya" and supplied to Japanese sweets makers.
The tane is generally produced by professional manufacturers of Japanese sweets materials called "taneya" and supplied to Japanese sweets makers.
The tane is generally produced by professional manufacturers of Japanese sweets materials called "taneya" and supplied to Japanese sweets makers.

sen.j: ごく一部の和菓子店では最中皮の製造も行っているようだ。
sen.e: Only a part of Japanese sweets makers still seem to produce the thin crisp wafers of monaka.
Only a part of Japanese sweets makers still seem to produce the thin crisp wafers of monaka.
Only a part of Japanese sweets makers still seem to produce the thin crisp wafers of monaka.

sen.j: 餡についてはアズキなど色々な種類がある。
sen.e: There are various kinds of bean jam such as azuki bean.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There are various kinds of bean jam such as azuki bean.
There are various kinds of bean jam such as azuki bean.

sen.j: 最中の餡は、皮種が湿気を帯びるのを避けるべく水分の含有率を下げており、その分、砂糖の量が多めとなっていることから、照りや粘りが強い。
sen.e: The bean jam in monaka includes less water in it to avoid the tane from getting wet, therefore an amount of sugar is larger, resulting in its shine and high viscosity.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The bean jam in monaka includes less water in it to avoid the tane from getting wet, therefore an amount of sugar is larger, resulting in its shine and high viscosity.
The bean jam in monaka includes less water in it to avoid the tane from getting wet, therefore an amount of sugar is larger, resulting in its shine and high viscosity.

sen.j: この餡を2枚の皮を合わせた状態で隙間がなくなる程度に1枚の皮種へ盛り付けていき、最後に餡を封じる皮種を揃えかぶせて完成となる。
sen.e: The bean jam is put on one of the tane so that there will not be any space when another tane is placed, and the other tane is finally placed on the bean jam for completion.
The bean jam is put on one of the tane so that there will not be any space when another tane is placed, and the other tane is finally placed on the bean jam for completion.
The bean jam is put on one of the tane so that there will not be any space when another tane is placed, and the other tane is finally placed on the bean jam for completion.

sen.j: 皮種が湿気るのを避けるために、販売時には餡と別にしておき、食べる時に消費者が餡を詰められるようにした商品もある。
sen.e: There are also some products including the bean jam and the tane separately to prevent the tane from getting wet, so that a consumer can put the bean jam in the tane when he eats it.
There are also some products including the bean jam and the tane separately to prevent the tane from getting wet, so that a consumer can put the bean jam in the tane when he/she eats it.
There are also some products including the bean jam and the tane separately to prevent the tane from getting wet, so that a consumer can put the bean jam in the tane when he or she eats it.
sen.cmt: he/she→he or she（統一用語リストに合わせました）

sen.j: 名前の由来
sen.e: Origin of name
Origin of the name
Origin of the name

sen.j: 池の面に照る月なみを数うれば今宵ぞ秋のもなかなりける
sen.e: As I see the moon reflected on the pond, I realize it is the middle of autumn tonight.
As I see the moon reflected on the pond, I realize it is the middle of autumn tonight.
As I see the moon reflected on the pond, I realize it is the middle of autumn tonight.

sen.j: 拾遺和歌集（巻3・秋171）にある源順の句を知っていた公家たちが、宮中で行われた月見の宴において白くて丸い餅菓子が出されたのを見て、会話の中で「もなかの月」という言葉が出たことから、そのまま菓子の名前として定着したという由来がある。
sen.e: Court nobles who knew the poem by MINAMOTO no Shitago in Shui Wakashu' (Collection of Gleanings of Japanese Poems) (volume 3, autumn 171) uttered a word "monaka no tsuki (moon in the middle)" in their conversation as they saw white and round rice cake sweets served in a moon-viewing banquet held in the court, and the word "monaka no tsuki" was used as the name of the sweets.

Court nobles who knew the poem by MINAMOTO no Shitago in Shui Wakashu (Collection of Gleanings of Japanese Poems) (volume 3, autumn 171) uttered a word 'monaka no tsuki' (moon in the middle) in their conversation as they saw white and round rice cake sweets served in a moon-viewing banquet held in the court, and the word 'monaka no tsuki' was used as the name of the sweets.
sen.cmt: 不要なクォーテーション削除、シングルクォーテーションに変更、位置を移動
sen.e: Court nobles who knew the poem by MINAMOTO no Shitago in Shui Wakashu (Collection of Gleanings of Japanese Poems) (volume 3, autumn 171) uttered a word 'monaka no tsuki' (moon in the middle) in their conversation as they saw white and round rice cake sweets served in a moon-viewing banquet held in the court, and the word 'monaka no tsuki' was used as the name of the sweets.

sen.j: 江戸時代に考案された最中の原型も、この話に基づいて生み出したといわれ、菓子の名前も話そのままに「最中の月」と命名された。
sen.e: It is believed that the prototype of monaka invented in Edo period was produced based on this story, and it was also named "monaka no tsuki" as in the story.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is believed that the prototype of monaka invented in Edo period was produced based on this story, and it was also named 'monaka no tsuki' as in the story.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更
sen.e: It is believed that the prototype of monaka invented in Edo period was produced based on this story, and it was also named 'monaka no tsuki' as in the story.

sen.j: しかし、後に円形でないものが出回り始めた後は、単に「最中」と称されるようになった。
sen.e: However, when those in a non-circular shape came into market later, they were called simply "monaka."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, when those in a non-circular shape came into market later, they were called simply 'monaka.'
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更
sen.e: However, when those in a non-circular shape came into market later, they were called simply 'monaka.'

sen.j: 銘菓としての最中
sen.e: Monaka as famous confection
Monaka as famous confections
Monaka as famous confections

sen.j: 現在は全国各地で作られ、土産や贈答品などとして販売される傾向にある。
sen.e: They are produced in many placed over the country, and tend to be sold as souvenirs and gifts.
They are produced in many placed over the country, and tend to be sold as souvenirs and gifts.
They are produced in many placed over the country, and tend to be sold as souvenirs and gifts.

sen.j: 路面電車を模った東京都の「都電もなか」、神奈川県湘南地域の「江ノ電もなか」、大阪府堺市の「ちんちん電車もなか」、また富士重工業の自動車を模った、群馬県太田市の「スバル最中」、千葉県成田市の「ぴーなっつ最中」、二輪レースで有名なモリワキのモリワキ最中(モナカ管を模したもの…受注生産)のなど、形状もさまざまである。
sen.e: There are various shapes of monaka, for example, those modeling a streetcar such as "Toden Monaka" in Tokyo, "Enoden Monaka" in Shonan area of Kanagawa Prefecture, "Chinchin-densha Monaka" in Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture, "Subaru Monaka" modeling an automobile of Fuji Heavy Industries Ltd. in Ota City, Gunma Prefecture, "Peanut Monaka" in Narita City, Chiba Prefecture, and Moriwaki Monaka (modeling a monaka muffler... produced by order) by Moriwaki Engineering Co., Ltd. known for motorcycle races.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There are various shapes of monaka, for example, those modeling a streetcar such as 'Toden Monaka' in Tokyo, 'Enoden Monaka' in Shonan area of Kanagawa Prefecture, 'Chinchin-densha Monaka' in Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture, 'Subaru Monaka' modeling an automobile of Fuji Heavy Industries Ltd. in Ota City, Gunma Prefecture, 'Peanut Monaka' in Narita City, Chiba Prefecture, and Moriwaki Monaka (modeling a monaka muffler... produced by order) by Moriwaki Engineering Co., Ltd. known for motorcycle races.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更
sen.e: There are various shapes of monaka, for example, those modeling a streetcar such as 'Toden Monaka' in Tokyo, 'Enoden Monaka' in Shonan area of Kanagawa Prefecture, 'Chinchin-densha Monaka' in Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture, 'Subaru Monaka' modeling an automobile of Fuji Heavy Industries Ltd. in Ota City, Gunma Prefecture, 'Peanut Monaka' in Narita City, Chiba Prefecture, and Moriwaki Monaka (modeling a monaka muffler... produced by order) by Moriwaki Engineering Co., Ltd. known for motorcycle races.

sen.j: 中には皮種がとじ切れないほどの餡を盛り込む横浜市の「喜最中」のように、常識的な最中の形から外れるものもある。
sen.e: Some of the monaka deviate from a general shape of monaka like "Kimonaka" in Yokohama City, which contains so much bean jam that the tane cannot close.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Some of the monaka deviate from a general shape of monaka like 'Kimonaka' in Yokohama City, which contains so much bean jam that the tane cannot close.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更
sen.e: Some of the monaka deviate from a general shape of monaka like 'Kimonaka' in Yokohama City, which contains so much bean jam that the tane cannot close.

sen.j: 宮城県では、仙台市に本店のある「白松がモナカ」「寿の三色最中」の2ブランドが名物で、両者とも（特に前者は）当該地域のテレビCMだけでなく屋外広告なども盛んに行っているほど広告に力を入れている。
sen.e: In Miyagi Prefecture, two brands of "Shiramatsu ga Monaka Honpo Ltd." and "Kotobuki Sanshokumonaka Honpo.,ltd" headquartered in Sendai City are famous specialties, and both (especially the former) focus on advertising such as commercial films on local televisions and outdoor advertisement.

In Miyagi Prefecture, two brands of 'Shiramatsu ga Monaka Honpo Ltd.' and 'Kotobuki Sanshokumonaka Honpo.,ltd' headquartered in Sendai City are famous specialties, and both (especially the former) focus on advertising such as commercial films on local televisions and outdoor advertisement.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更
sen.e: In Miyagi Prefecture, two brands of 'Shiramatsu ga Monaka Honpo Ltd.' and 'Kotobuki Sanshokumonaka Honpo.,ltd' headquartered in Sendai City are famous specialties, and both (especially the former) focus on advertising such as commercial films on local televisions and outdoor advertisement.

sen.j: 台湾の最中
sen.e: Monaka in Taiwan
Monaka in Taiwan
Monaka in Taiwan

sen.j: 20世紀の初頭、日本統治時代 (台湾)が50年間続いた台湾には、和菓子の製造技術も伝えられたため、現在も地元の菓子店で草餅、最中、羊羹などの製造が行われている。
sen.e: In the beginning of the 20th century, the production technique of Japanese sweets were brought into Taiwan, which was governed by Japan for fifty years, and therefore kusa mochi (rice-flour dumplings mixed with mugwort), monaka, and yokan are still produced in local confectionaries.

In the beginning of the 20th century, the production techniques of Japanese sweets were brought into Taiwan, which was governed by Japan for fifty years, and therefore kusa mochi (rice-flour dumplings mixed with mugwort), monaka, and yokan are still produced in local confectioneries.

In the beginning of the 20th century, the production techniques of Japanese sweets were brought into Taiwan, which was governed by Japan for fifty years, and therefore kusa mochi (rice-flour dumplings mixed with mugwort), monaka, and yokan are still produced in local confectioneries.

sen.j: 台湾で最中は「最中」（ツイチョン）または「最中餅」（ツイチョンピン）と呼ばれている。
sen.e: In Taiwan, monaka is called "zui zhong" or "zui zhong bing."
In Taiwan, monaka is called 'zui zhong' or 'zui zhong bing.'
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更
sen.e: In Taiwan, monaka is called 'zui zhong' or 'zui zhong bing.'

sen.j: 台湾の最中は、小豆餡の外に、ハスの実餡のものも一般的である。
sen.e: Not only monaka with azuki bean jam but also those with lotus-pip paste are popular in Taiwan.
Not only monaka with azuki bean jam but also those with lotus-pip paste are popular in Taiwan.
Not only monaka with azuki bean jam but also those with lotus-pip paste are popular in Taiwan.

sen.j: 他に、台湾らしさのある、黒糖を使った餡や、コーヒー餡などの独自の新しい商品も生まれている。
sen.e: Furthermore, there are unique products using the bean jam with brown sugar and coffee-flavored bean jam, providing Taiwanese taste.
Furthermore, there are unique products using the bean jam with brown sugar and coffee-flavored bean jam, providing Taiwanese taste.
Furthermore, there are unique products using the bean jam with brown sugar and coffee-flavored bean jam, providing Taiwanese taste.

sen.j: 皮種の形状は、伝統的な円盤型のものが多いが、店によっては貝殻型などの個性的なものを作っている場合もある。
sen.e: Most of the tane have a traditional shape of a disc, but some manufacturers produce them in such a unique shape as a shell.
Most of the tane have a traditional shape of a disc, but some manufacturers produce them in such a unique shape as a shell.
Most of the tane have a traditional shape of a disc, but some manufacturers produce them in such a unique shape as a shell.

sen.j: その他
sen.e: Others
Others
Others

sen.j: 皮種はウエハースの代わりとして、アイスクリームなどを包むのに使われることもある。
sen.e: The tane is sometimes used to sandwich ice cream or the like instead of wafers.
The tane is sometimes used to sandwich ice cream or the like instead of wafers.
The tane is sometimes used to sandwich ice cream or the like instead of wafers.

sen.j: 懐中汁粉 皮種を用いた、汁粉の素。
sen.e: Kaichu jiruko Instant shiruko (sweet red-bean soup with pieces of rice cake) using the tane.
Kaichu jiruko: Instant shiruko (sweet red-bean soup with pieces of rice cake) using the tane.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペース消去、コロン追加*原文に「しるこ」とありますが、ウェブ上では「懐中汁粉」となっており、リンク先の単語のようです。しるこでは意味が通じないので原文も「懐中汁粉」としました。
sen.e: Kaichu jiruko: Instant shiruko (sweet red-bean soup with pieces of rice cake) using the tane.

sen.j: 皮種の片側をタルト生地の代わりに用い、アーモンドなどを詰めた洋菓子風の菓子を作っている業者もある。
sen.e: Some manufacturers produce western type of sweets using a piece of tane as a tart pastry and filling it with almond and the like.
Some manufacturers produce western type of sweets using a piece of tane as a tart pastry and filling it with almond and the like.
Some manufacturers produce western type of sweets using a piece of tane as a tart pastry and filling it with almond and the like.

sen.j: 機械等において、2枚の外装を左右あるいは上下に貼り合わせた構造を、外装を皮に、内部機構を餡に見立てて「モナカ構造」という。
sen.e: In the field of machinery, a structure including two exterior members stuck together to right and left or to top and bottom is referred to as "monaka structure" regarding the exterior members as the thin crispy wafers and the internal mechanism as the bean jam.

In the field of machinery, a structure including two exterior members stuck together to right and left or to top and bottom is referred to as 'monaka structure' regarding the exterior members as the thin crispy wafers and the internal mechanism as the bean jam.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更
sen.e: In the field of machinery, a structure of two exterior parts stuck together horizontally or vertically is referred to as 'monaka structure' supposing that the experior parts are the thin crispy wafers and the internal machinery is the bean jam.
sen.cmt: 左右あるいは上下」を変更しました。「見立てて」を変更しました。
